normalized: the next day, in the early morning.
the 'onmyo agency' branch hq at the kitahama district.
the rooftop.
while the helicopter is creating a whirlwind, an elderly persondisembarks from it.
he is accompanied by a large number of men inblack clothes.
this is the 'agency's' chief, ryumei abe.
ever since the heian period, the abe family had been leading thediviners.
ryumei is the current head of the family.
he is known as the strongest diviner knight.
despite being over 80 years old, he is also a master swordsman and theage hadn't dulled the sharpness of his sight.

name: koso
normalized: this is an unexpected visit.
koso, the general manager of 'onmyo agency's' r&d greets ryumei.

name: ryumei
normalized: indeed.
i am supposed to accompany the minister of foreign affairsin a conference with european union.

name: koso
normalized: the minister is likely trying to improve his standing for the nextelection.
ryumei nods for koso to accompany him.

name: ryumei
normalized: well then, koso.
had there been any progress in the matter?

name: koso
normalized: and the 'matter' you speak of is…
koso glances over at the old diviner for confirmation.

name: ryumei
normalized: indeed.
the matter of towako yagyu.

name: koso
normalized: yes, sir.
everything is progressing as intended.
koso knew from the beginning what ryumei was talking about, so heprepared an answer in advance.

name: ryumei
normalized: and my return trip from europe…

name: koso
normalized: everything is arranged.

name: ryumei
normalized: *nod* you have my thanks.

name: koso
normalized: much obliged…
koso bows deeply, hiding his expression.
ryumei silently heads toward the government officials who welcome him,while koso remains bowed until the old man leaves.
afternoon.
mikio is once again at 'shinmachi paperback'.

name: mikio
normalized: helloo~!
the boy yells as he enters the library.

name: reika
normalized: welcome.
reika greets him.

name: mikio
normalized: ah, big sis reika.
good day.
mikio bows his head and then notices that someone is missing from herusual spot.

name: mikio
normalized: where's towako?

name: reika
normalized: unfortunately, milady is still at school.

name: mikio
normalized: huh.

name: reika
normalized: i see you're disappointed, mikio.

name: mikio
normalized: y-yeah, i am…
reika watches the kid turn red with surprising swiftness.

name: reika
normalized: have a seat, you can wait for her here.
i'll bring you cocoa in amoment.
having said so, the butler disappears into the kitchen.

name: mikio
normalized: um, uh…thanks…
he takes a sit and pretends to read a book in order to hide hisblushing face.
mikio didn't even have time to turn a page, when reika already broughthim hot, steamy cocoa.

name: reika
normalized: there you go, mikio.
although reika normally has no trouble presenting the cup and a saucer,today her hand is trembling slightly and she spills the drink.

name: reika
normalized: ah…

name: mikio
normalized: big sis?
for the butler, who always does her job perfectly, such trivial mistakeis unusual.
did he notice it?
the kid glances over at reika.

name: reika
normalized: my apologies, i've been having a slight fever ever since thismorning.
so she says.
if one looks close enough, one can notice that her face is slightlyflustered.

name: mikio
normalized: as i thought!

name: reika
normalized: huh?
what do you mean?

name: mikio
normalized: for the past few days i thought that big sis looked somewhatunusual.
reika laughs at the boy's anxious look.

name: reika
normalized: for about a week, yes.
but i must say, you are very observant.
even milady didn't notice my condition.
it doesn't look like she's lying, so mikio beams at the sudden praise.

name: mikio
normalized: ehehe.
if you say so.
the kid is embarressed from being praised by an older lady.

name: reika
normalized: please keep it a secret from milady.
it is no big deal, so weshouldn't make her worry.

name: mikio
normalized: yep!
it'll be our secret.

name: reika
normalized: indeed.

name: mikio
normalized: well then, since towako is still not back yet, i brought this forbig sis reika.
the boy rummages a bit in his bag and takes out something.

name: reika
normalized: what is it?

name: mikio
normalized: my grandma works in a chinese pharmacy.
since sister reika wasn'tfeeling well, i asked her to mix up a medicine that would make youfeel better.

name: reika
normalized: is that so?
you're so kind, mikio.
thank you.
the butler clasps her hands around his hand as she accepts the present,impressed by the boy's caring heart.
mikio's face turns even redder and he jumps up from his seat inpanic.

name: mikio
normalized: i-it's nothing.
a-a-anyway, i should run back home and finish thebook i borrowed yesterday.
see ya, big sis reika!
get well soon.
mikio dashes out of the library as if he's being chased, leaving behindhis medicine and an untouched cup of cocoa.

name: reika
normalized: it makes me wonder if he'd reached that age already?
reika mutters to herself a little regretfully.
it is evening and towako is heading back home from school.

name: towako
normalized: *munch munch*.
ta-tashtyy~!

the tasty smell of lard on a fried croquette hangs in the air.

name: towako
normalized: fried tashtes the besht after all!
*munch munch*.
such a blissful smile is more fitting for a commonplace hungry studentthan for a diviner knight.

name: old lady
normalized: ah, if it isn't young towako.
heading home already?
a familiar chatty old lady calls her over.

name: towako
normalized: au, augh!
*gulp!
*…good day.
are you shopping for dinner,ma'am?

name: old lady
normalized: yes.
when i ask them at home "what would you like for dinner?
",they say "anything is fine".
but when i go through the trouble ofmaking something tasty, they complain anyway.

name: towako
normalized: ahaha.
oh well, that happens, i guess.

name: old lady
normalized: aye.
day in, day out i have to think up the menu.
i wish they'dput themselves in my place just once!

name: towako
normalized: yep, the food they sell is still the best.

half is for her and half- for reika.

normalized: maybe i should make a croquette too.

normalized: ah, they're selling oversized mincemeat cutlets there today.
i wantedto buy some, but the line was so long, that i decided against it.

normalized: what?
really?

i'll head over to the store rightaway.

name: towako
normalized: wow…a housewife's strength…what an amazing thing.
as the girl is filled with admiration and munches on her snack,another neighbour calls her over.

name: morita

normalized: ah, mister morita.
how do you do?
this time she is addressed by a friendly owner of an electronicsstore.

name: towako
normalized: have you sneaked out again, even though you have a place to run?

normalized: why, towako!
after looking at my old crone all day long i justcouldn't help myself when i saw your lovely face.
be nice to thisold man.

normalized: still saying such things…

name: towako
normalized: i didn't know that you dislike your wife so much.
but if you don'ttalk to her about it, it'll only keep getting more frustrating.

normalized: ugh, towako, you're so mature.
reika's guidance must be rubbing offon you.
despite acting the way he does and calling his wife a 'crone', moritais actually known as a faithful husband.

in short, quite a meddlesome old man.

normalized: towako, welcome back!

normalized: good day.

normalized: what's the matter, gontaro?
the girl looks puzzled.

name: towako
normalized: ah…

we need to talk.

get in.

normalized: understood.
